metadata.title: CVE-2017-0902 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
RubyGems version 2.6.12 and earlier is vulnerable to a DNS hijackingvulnerability that allows a MITM attacker to force the RubyGems client todownload and install gems from a server that the attacker controls.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-0902` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0 - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
ruby2.0-tcltk - 2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ruby2.0 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0.484-1ubuntu2.10').
jruby package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
